intro: Rhomboda taiwaniana, commonly known as the Taiwan rhombodan, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rhomboid-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
